intro: Cyrtandra makalehaensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest habitats, often near streams or on rocky slopes. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy appearance. Cyrtandra makalehaensis is considered a rare and endangered species, facing threats from habitat loss and invasive species.
